title: 6% DA for HRTC staff
text:
Tribune News Service
Shimla, October 2
Apart from announcing 6 per cent dearness allowance (DA) to the Himachal Road Transport Corporation (HRTC) employees and pensioners, Chief Minister Virbhadra Singh said the state government was creating a corpus fund to solve the problems of pension, gratuity, leave encashment of employees of the HRTC, so that they get all benefits without any delay. The Chief Minister presided over the Foundation Day of the HRTC today. He said the state government was committed to the welfare of the employees, but there was a need to change the system in the larger interest of the employees. He said the HRTC had introduced 1,200 new buses recently, and was in profit and 300 more buses had been approved by the board. “Rs 25 crore is being spent on the construction of nine bus stands in the state, besides 16 ultra modern workshops are also being constructed under the Jawaharlal Nehru Urban Renewal Mission by spending Rs 67.18 crore,” he said. He said as many as 1,900 persons had been given appointment in the HRTC, besides 550 employees had been regularised and 228 piece-meal workers had been made contractual employees in the last two-and-a-half years. Transport Minister GS Bali said the state government was committed to fulfill the demands of the employees. “The HRTC has suffered a loss of Rs 540 crore, but today besides an increase in the mileage, it has earned revenue of Rs 580 crore in 2014-15, which was Rs 432 crore in 2013-14,” he added. As a special case, Bali sought permission from the Chief Minister to employ one member of a family each of those who died in an accident today near Bhota while coming to Shimla to attend a function. He also announced to give his salary to the next of the kin of the deceased, besides assistance as per the norms. President HRTC Officers Association Anil Sen demanded conversion of the HRTC into Himachal Pradesh Roadways.
